SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AssetSetter
Responsible for initializing and placing game objects on the game board in the "Rabbit Run" game.
CollisionChecker
Handles collision detection in the "Rabbit Run" game, checking if entities collide with tiles or objects on the game board.
CollisionCheckerObject
Handles collision detection between entities and objects in the game.
Enemy
Represents an enemy entity in the Rabbit Run game.
Entity
Represents an entity within the game, including attributes for position, speed, directional images, and collision handling.
GamePanel
Main game panel that handles game rendering, updating, and main game loop.
ImageLoadingException
Custom exception class for errors encountered during image loading.
KeyHandler
The KeyHandler class handles keyboard inputs for controlling player movement and game state changes.
Main
The Main class initializes and displays the main window for the RabbitRun game.
MapLoadingException
Custom exception class for errors encountered during map loading.
MouseListener
Custom MouseListener for handling button clicks in the RabbitRun game.
ObjBonusReward
Represents a bonus reward object in the "Rabbit Run" game.
ObjExitDoor
Represents the exit door object in the "Rabbit Run" game.
ObjPunishment
Represents a punishment object in the "Rabbit Run" game.
ObjReward
Represents a regular reward object in the "Rabbit Run" game.
PickObjectHandler
Handles interactions with in-game objects during gameplay.
Player
Represents the player character in the game, including attributes for position, movement, score, and interactions with objects.
Sound
Manages the sound effects in the "Rabbit Run" game, including loading, playing, looping, and stopping audio clips.
SoundLoadingException
Custom exception class for errors encountered during sound loading.
SuperObject
Represents a generic game object in the "Rabbit Run" game.
Tile
Represents a tile in the "Rabbit Run" game.
TileManager
Manages tiles in the "Rabbit Run" game, including loading tile images, reading map data, and drawing tiles within the visible area of the game.
UI
The UI class is responsible for rendering all the user interface components in the RabbitRun game.
